alert.note: Alert for Billings; Golden Valley; Stark (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 2:22PM CST until February 21 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations less than one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero expected. * WHERE...Billings, Golden Valley, and Stark Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate clothing, covering exposed skin. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
